holidays.name: Santa Claus Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the jolliest man in a red suit by honoring Saint Nicholas, the original inspiration behind Santa Claus.
holidays.origin: This day marks the feast day of Saint Nicholas, a 4th-century bishop known for his generosity, especially to children, which evolved into the modern Santa Claus legend.
holidays.funFact: Saint Nicholas was known for secretly giving gifts; one story tells of him dropping gold coins down a chimney to help a poor family!

holidays.name: National Cookie Day (USA)
holidays.description: Indulge your sweet tooth by baking, sharing, or devouring delicious cookies of every variety!
holidays.origin: The holiday began as a fun food celebration in the United States to appreciate cookies and the joy they bring.
holidays.funFact: The chocolate chip cookie was invented in 1938 by Ruth Wakefield, who ran the Toll House Inn.

holidays.name: World Computer Literacy Day
holidays.description: A day to promote digital literacy and encourage people of all ages to explore the wonders of computers and technology.
holidays.origin: Founded in 2001 by the Indian computer company NIIT to raise awareness about computer literacy around the globe.
holidays.funFact: Despite being founded in 2001, millions around the world still lack basic computer skills, making this day crucial for digital inclusion.

holidays.name: National Dice Day
holidays.description: Roll the dice and celebrate the tiny cubes that have determined board game fates for centuries!
holidays.origin: This unofficial day celebrates the invention and use of dice, believed to be one of the oldest gaming tools dating back thousands of years.
holidays.funFact: The oldest known dice were excavated from a site in Mesopotamia and are over 5,000 years old!
